OQS - Viewing Case Number 06049528 Page 2 of 3
PALM BEACH COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE
CASE NO. 06049528
REPORT NUMBER: 1
FLORIDA VICTIM ? N
WEATHER: CLEAR
WITNESS TO CRIME KNOWN ? Y
CAN VICTIM I.D. SUSPECT ? Y
WILL VICTIM PROSECUTE ? Y
IS M.O. SIGNIFICANT ? Y
LAW ENTS LIFTED ? N
TAG NUMBER KNOWN ? N
ARRESTING OFFICER ? D/S SHAPPEE/ID. 6376
SUSPECT NAME KNOWN ? Y
SUSPECT LOCATION KNOWN ? Y
STOLEN PROPERTY TRACEABLE ? N
SUSPECT'S VEHICLE KNOWN ? N
EVIDENCE LIFTED AT SCENE ? N
PROPERTY DAMAGE ? N
ON MARCH 31, 2006 AT APPROXIMATELY 0925 HOURS, I RESPONDED TO 16745 WEST DOWNERS DRIVE, IN LOXAHATCHEE, IN REFERENCE TO A MISSING PERSON INVESTIGATION.
I WAS ADVISED BY DISPATCH THAT SHERIFF'S OFFICE IN ORDER TO REPORT THAT HIS DAUGHTER, , HAD FIND THE RESIDENCE ON FOOT IN AN UNKNOWN DIRECTION OF TRAVEL DURING A VERBAL ARGUMENT.
UPON ARRIVAL TO THE RESIDENCE, REPORTED THAT HAD RETURNED AND WAS INSIDE THE RESIDENCE PACKING HER CLOTHING IN ORDER TO MOVE OUT. THEN STATED THEY (AROUND 5:45 AM ON TODAY'S DATE, ) HAD SNUCK BACK INTO THE RESIDENCE AFTER BEING CUT ALL NIGHT STATED THAT THEY WERE DROPPED OFF BY A YOUNG DRUG DEALER, AND UPON THEIR ARRIVAL WERE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF A NARCOTIC AS THEY COULD BARELY STAND UP, THEIR EYES WERE FLOODSHOT, AND THEIR PUPILS WERE DILATED.
HOWEVER, I SHORT TIME LATER, THE SCHOOL POLICE OFFICER, CALLED HIM IN ORDER TO PICK UP BECAUSE SHE WAS BELIEVED TO BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF NARCOTICS.
DURING THEIR DRIVE FROM THE SCHOOL BACK TO THEIR RESIDENCE, STATED THAT CONTINUOUSLY SAID HOW MUCH SHE HATED HIM AND WISHED THAT HE WOULD DIE.
UPON ENTERING THE RESIDENCE, SHE CONTINUED SCREAMING PROFANITIES AT HIM AND STATED THAT SHE WOULD RUN AWAY. STATED THAT HE THEN SHUT HER BEDROOM DOOR AND SAID YOU CAN MAKE A CHOICE, STAY HERE OR LEAVE THE HOUSE.
THEN STATED AT THIS TIME, BEGAN TO SWING HER ARMS AND FIST WILDLY AT HIM, STRIKING HIM SEVERAL TIMES IN THE LEFT AND RIGHT FOREARM AND IN THE CHEST, SCREAMING THAT SHE HATED HIM AND WANTED HIM TO DIE.
printed by Employee Id #: 4561 on April 05, 2006 04
http://oqs.pbso.org/index.cfm?fa=dspCase&fromrec=1&srhta=d67d417bd0dae93-6BB4D01... 4/5/2006
07/26/17 Page 86 of 95 Public Records Request No.: 17-295 DOJ-OGR-00031083

ON MARCH 31, 2006 AT APPROXIMATELY 0925 HOURS, I RESPONDED TO 16745 WEST DOWNERS DRIVE, IN LOXAHATCHEE, IN REFERENCE TO A MISSING PERSON INVESTIGATION.
I WAS ADVISED BY DISPATCH THAT SHERIFF'S OFFICE IN ORDER TO REPORT THAT HIS DAUGHTER, , HAD FIND THE RESIDENCE ON FOOT IN AN UNKNOWN DIRECTION OF TRAVEL DURING A VERBAL ARGUMENT.
UPON ARRIVAL TO THE RESIDENCE, REPORTED THAT HAD RETURNED AND WAS INSIDE THE RESIDENCE PACKING HER CLOTHING IN ORDER TO MOVE OUT. THEN STATED THEY (AROUND 5:45 AM ON TODAY'S DATE, ) HAD SNUCK BACK INTO THE RESIDENCE AFTER BEING CUT ALL NIGHT STATED THAT THEY WERE DROPPED OFF BY A YOUNG DRUG DEALER, AND UPON THEIR ARRIVAL WERE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF A NARCOTIC AS THEY COULD BARELY STAND UP, THEIR EYES WERE FLOODSHOT, AND THEIR PUPILS WERE DILATED.
HOWEVER, I SHORT TIME LATER, THE SCHOOL POLICE OFFICER, CALLED HIM IN ORDER TO PICK UP BECAUSE SHE WAS BELIEVED TO BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF NARCOTICS.
DURING THEIR DRIVE FROM THE SCHOOL BACK TO THEIR RESIDENCE, STATED THAT CONTINUOUSLY SAID HOW MUCH SHE HATED HIM AND WISHED THAT HE WOULD DIE.
UPON ENTERING THE RESIDENCE, SHE CONTINUED SCREAMING PROFANITIES AT HIM AND STATED THAT SHE WOULD RUN AWAY. STATED THAT HE THEN SHUT HER BEDROOM DOOR AND SAID YOU CAN MAKE A CHOICE, STAY HERE OR LEAVE THE HOUSE.
THEN STATED AT THIS TIME, BEGAN TO SWING HER ARMS AND FIST WILDLY AT HIM, STRIKING HIM SEVERAL TIMES IN THE LEFT AND RIGHT FOREARM AND IN THE CHEST, SCREAMING THAT SHE HATED HIM AND WANTED HIM TO DIE.

additional_notes: The document appears to be a police report from the Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office. The report details a missing person investigation and a subsequent altercation between the victim and the suspect. The document is typed and contains no handwritten notes or stamps. The quality of the document is clear, with no visible redactions or damage.
